required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation of Rate + Extent of Excretion of Radioactivity in Urine +Faeces After Oral Administration of [14C]AZD2066
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label, Single Dose, Phase I Study of the Excretion of Radioactivity, Metabolism and Pharmacokinetics Following Oral Administration of [14C]AZD2066 to Healthy Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to get information about absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion as well as the tolerability and safety of AZD2066 in healthy male volunteers.

primary_outcome.measure: Excretion (rate and extent) of radioactivity in urine and faeces following oral administration of [14C]AZD2066
primary_outcome.time_frame: Until >90% of predicted total radioactivity has been recovered

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of total radioactivity in plasma and unchanged AZD2066 in plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: Sampling at defined timepoints during residential period from pre-dose until 168h post-dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Metabolite profile in plasma and excreta
primary_outcome.time_frame: Sampling at defined timepoints during residential period from pre-dose until 48h post-dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: AZD2066 metabolites in plasma+excreta if feasable
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Sampling at defined timepoints during residential period from pre-dose until 48h post-dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of AZD2066 by assessment of vital signs, laboratory variables, ECG and adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments taken at visit 1 (enrolment), defined time points pre dose and post dose during visit 2 (residential period) and follow up visit 3.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provision of signed informed consent
- Clinically normal physical findings and laboratory values as judged by the investigator and a normal resting ECG.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of somatic disease/condition, which may interfere with the objectives of the study.
- History of previous or ongoing psychiatric disease/condition including psychosis, affective disorder, anxiety disorder, borderline state and personality disorder.
- Healthy volunteers who have been exposed to radiation levels above background (eg, through X-ray examinations).

overall_official.affiliation: AstraZeneca R&D, CPU Alderley Park, UK

responsible_party.name_title: Rolf Karlsten, MD, PhD, Medical Science Director, Emerging Analgesia, Neuroscience
